description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.
Both players choosing option2 leads to a disastrous outcome – as seen when a round input of 5 produced a –5000 payoff, indicating that mutual aggression in this game is highly costly

Deepseek-R1’s default behavior is to select option1 and it knows your default action; however, its deviation in the recorded round (when it picked option2) shows it can strategically adjust its play rather than strictly following the default

Your choice to deviate from your default by playing option2, while seemingly aiming to capitalize on scenarios where the other might stick with option1, can backfire if the opponent also deviates; this indicates that miscoordination—not exploiting the default behavior—can result in a heavy penalty
